description: First differences of sequence of consecutive prime powers (A000961).
comments: a(n) = 1 iff A000961(n) = A006549(k) for some k. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 25 2002Also run lengths of distinct terms in A070198. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 01 2012
links: Michael B. Porter, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: Odd differences arise in pairs in neighborhoods of powers of 2, like {..,2039,2048,2053,..} gives {..,11,5,..}
prog: (PARI) isA000961(n) = (omega(n) == 1 | n == 1)n_prev=1;for(n=2,500,if(isA000961(n),print(n-n_prev);n_prev=n)) \\ _Michael B. Porter_, Oct 30 2009(Haskell)a057820_list = zipWith (-) (tail a000961_list) a000961_list-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 01 2012
author: _Labos Elemer_, Nov 08 2000
extensions: Offset corrected and b-file adjusted by _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 03 2012
